bwwExcerpt: There's nothing terribly wrong with Carnage, the film version of Yasmina Reza's Tony-winning stage comedy God of Carnage. But there's nothing trippingly right with it either. What bubbled on stage lacks fizz on screen...the film version of Carnage hasn't just lost God from its title, it's lost the laughs from the play that brought it life.
rejectionReasoning: claude: This is a film review of 'Carnage' (2011 movie), not a Broadway theater review; openai: The text is about the film version of 'God of Carnage', not the Broadway production.; kimi: This text is a review of the 2011 film 'Carnage' (the Roman Polanski movie adaptation), not the Broadway play 'God of Carnage'. The critic explicitly states they are reviewing 'the film version' and compares it unfavorably to the stage production, but the evaluation is of the cinematic adaptation, not the theatrical show itself.
